name: Doris
review: Stays on and doesn't make face shine..

name: Las Anas
review: Be careful when applying it...it can get a little messy.  But nothing that you can't control once you get use to use it.

name: Winner
review: Revlon skincare has been my choice for years. It works well for me.

name: Sandy
review: Have been very happy with the product.  Doesn't cake and collect around creases.  My T Zone is much easier to control with this product.

name: Kay
review: I've used this since i found it a couple of years ago, love it!

name: Rhonda
review: Thought this was a pressed cream.  Do not like powders.  Planning on returning.

name: Maggie
review: I was recommended this product when the color stay powder looked too dark. Iim a medium but it looked lighter. I love it! It was a couple of bucks more to buy a fan brush. I love the outcome!

name: Jan
review: I like Revlon product, because they are economical, excellent products, and I heard a long time ago that they are not tested on animals.  I do not know if this is true.

name: Raegirl
review: I've used this for years and I couldn't imagine switching to something else.

name: J. D.
review: Good coverage. Matches well.

name: Tessa
review: I use this product and compare it to Sephoras matifying powder and MAC pressed powder and I have to say I really like this product. if you have oily skin or problem red spots it is perfect for your skin!

name: Audrey
review: I like this quite a bit, but it doesn't have much color to it. The regular ColorStay powder is better. Don't pay more for this PhotoReady one.

name: sberrys
review: Heard good stuff about this product so I figured I'd try it out. I did not like it. It felt gritty, like it had not been finely milled enough (ground), it didn't feel silky at all. Coverage was VERY minimal. I have combo skin, some areas are dry, others get oily, and others are normal. The areas I have that are dry felt like the Sahara desert the longer I had this product on my face. I could literally feel it pulling the moisture out of my face and couldn't stand it anymore and had to remove it. My dry areas are not even all that dry so I was pretty shocked that I needed to take it off. This would probably be a decent product for someone with very oily skin all over who only requires very sheer coverage but this was just not for me. Even if it wasn't drying I just couldn't get past the gritty texture. Very disappointed in this product, but giving it 2 stars for it's oil absorbing properties which are amazing.

name: Laini
review: A very good foundation:-D

name: kaila.marie
review: i use this product over liquid foundation. and i really liked it at first then i noticed it has these shimmering flecks in it and i don't really like that part. but it sets foundation really well and doesn"t dry out my skin

name: kk
review: I love this powder!! it covers so much and you could barely tell that your  wearing it! its not cakey and it doesnt crease!

name: Connie
review: This powder gives you a finished look and helps to keep your base makeup from fading off.

name: Michelle
review: Disappointed, and I am such a revlon lover!The powder is too thick, and gets blotchy. You can't reapply this powder throughout the day. It will get thicker and messy. Good for a slight light powder fix when first applying.

name: Jenna
review: Great for finishing a liquid foundation.

name: cat
review: it's a little more caky than I thought it would be...but i use it

name: Stephanie
review: This is a good product when you need to save some money.

name: abby
review: good

name: Gingersnap
review: Have tried everything  Finally found a powder that looks and feels great!! So happy

name: Madster the Make Up addict
review: This powder goes on very well but when I put it on with just concealer or just it alone it looks caked on and wipes of too easily.

name: Linda
review: I use this everyday

name: Irish girl!
review: This powder covers well and blends easily.  No foundation needed!

name: Mermer
review:
The smell is extremely noticeable when applying this. It has a strong smell of dry wall or wet cardboard!!! I immediately smell it while applying it.
It also looks incredibly streaky and cakey. It doesn't blend well. My last foundation powder was a lot cheaper than this and it still worked better. It's really disappointing!

name: CyndiT
review: I keep this in my purse for touch ups throughout the day. Works great.  Only drawback is the brush that it comes with instead of a sponge. I use a sponge with this product.

name: Lynn
review: I used it years ago

name: Shar
review: This powder didn't quite work well for me. I have overall normal skin but this powder seemed to make me shinier faster. I love the smonth feel of the powder but it doesn't last. Also no surprise, their lightest color is still not realistically light enough.

name: Ash
review: I love this! I think it covers nicely, it's buildable so it can look cakey if you pack it on just like with a lot of other powders. It doesn't feel heavy and it controls shine all day. I think it does a better job controlling shine than the Revlon Colorstay powder which is what I switched from. I'm not sure why some people are saying that there is glitter in it.... There is a little shimmer to it because the shimmer helps reflect light during pictures (hence the name photoready..) but you can only see a little shimmer in certain lights. I think it looks pretty since it doesn't make your face look dry and matte.

name: Keely
review: I was using BareMinerals, but when i lost my job I couldn't afford to keep up my expensive habits.  I tried the Photo Ready line.  I quickly realized that I could use the Photo Ready Powder without having to use the foundation to get the coverage I needed.  I use a flat makeup sponge to apply it.  It goes on smooth and covers all of my red rosecea covered cheeks.  My 13 yr old daughter is now using it.

name: Mistydm320
review: I use this product daily and I love the coverage.

name: Lauren
review: I got this after needing a powder to set my foundation. I was told it was a good dupe for the Too Faced foundation powder. Oh, heck no. I have to pretty much scrub the powder with my brush to get it up, and doesn't cover very well. It's okay if you need something cheaper, but not really all that worth it. I do like that it has little bits of very, very fine gold micro-glitter in it to help illuminate your face though.

name: KatD
review: This powder is great. It is gentle, hasn't caused me Abby breakouts or skin issues. It lasts fairly well for drug store cosmetics and the light medium committee#20 is perfect. Very neutral, not top pink not too orange. I love it.

name: Mom!
review: easy to use powder with great finishing results.

name: Renetta rosetta
review: The brush that came with the product does not work well.  The packaging is difficult to open and the product does very little.  A waste of money.

name: redavis
review: I'm VERY picky about my powder. I don't like heavy, cakey powders. This one is my fav. It's not heavy at all. I did notice some sparkle upon opening, but I do not notice any when it's on.

name: Irvy
review:
I use this powder every day over my foundation and it's a winner. It's the perfect color for my ridiculously pale skin. I also really like how well it blends. Until I find something better - and I haven't yet - I'll stick with the Photo Ready.

I should add that I have VERY sensitive, problematic skin, and this doesn't clog pores/cause breakouts/redden my skin. It's gentle and gives good coverage if I do have any blemishes.

name: Marble
review: This is one of the worst powders I have EVER tried! It is so awful looking on the skin. If you have oily skin, larger pores, etc, STAY AWAY. Just so cakey and did absolutely nothing in terms of setting or keeping the greasy look at bay.

name: Ulta Lover
review: Wanted to try this product since I love Revlon. Applied this product and it looked okay in the house under bad lighting.. as I went outside and looked in my car mirror it looked as if cake was plastered on my face. Doesn't look natural and I used a small amount. Maybe a brush would of helped to apply instead of a sponge they give you.

name: Jenni Penni
review: Love this as a makeup setter.

name: Musicgeek63
review: It has great coverage and it lasts a long time but it can get cakey at times. But other then that its a pretty good product. It also has a strange smell to it but I know it doesn't bother some people.

name: Tiff
review: I use this everyday over my photo ready foundation and it adds a good finish to the look.

name: Dana Bug
review: I use this every day by using a large brush and dusting it all over my face after applying foundation. Helps it set and reduces shine. Also great for touch ups.

name: Caryl
review: This is the best powder I have found so far for my partly oily complexion that goes on without settling in fine lines and leaves a natural but more refined complexion. I would prefer better coverage however.

name: Blue Jean
review: The brush was shedding on my face. I am using my own brush, but still I feel I keep puting on more to set my foundation. It is messy too, maybe a pad would be better then a brush?

name: tamarano07
review: this is great! I am not one who usually wears foundation because it's always so unnatural looking, but this is so natural that I can hardly even tell I am wearing it!

name: Suzanne the 40 something
review: I like it because it is photoready and reasonably priced.  It does the job of a much more expensive product.

name: Zander
review: This is okay. I need a powder at the moment, but this one can be a bit heavy. It may be causing me to break out. And if you get dry skin, this certainly does not help.

name: Sways Mom
review: I was never a big fan of face powder. When I started wearing foundation more I decided I needed something to finish the look decided to give this product a try. Before this product I had never gone through an entire tin of powder... I have finished and replaced this powder four times now and keep going back!

name: Yulia
review: I have been using powders for almost 9 years. So, basically, I have tried everything possible from very expensive to cheap ones. This powder is by far the best. It stays at least 6 hours even on my oily skin and covers acne very well.

name: Ro
review: Excellent!!

name: mslncdl19
review: I loved the feel of this powder, but it tends to look cakey and cling to wrinkles. There is shimmer in this powder as well, so beware if you have large pores.

name: meezer
review: The powder is ok. It's light and good for controlling shine. The brush is horrible, though. The hairs come off all over your face.

name: Ellzie
review: This is really easy to apply and blends well, which is good, but it doesn't stay on for more than a few hours (and I don't touch my face any more than the next girl). It matches really well to your skin tone, it just doesn't stay on well.

name: hadhoudy
review: I was having the highest hopes for this powder but the glitter is too much and in the harshest to the softest lights it looks cakey I probably should try it with primer but I use only tinted moisturizer or bb cream sometimes I have a quite perfected complexion but I like to experiment but ill probably use it for under eyes since they use translucent powder under the eyes and the glitter would probably look better respond if you have the same problem tell how it's like for you

name: Ali
review: I've tried a million different powders, and none go on as easily or set as well as the Revlon PhotoReady. It is a bit cakey, but for oily skin (like myself) it blends beautifully within 20 minutes.

name: Ali
review: I've tried a million different powders, and none go on as easily or set as well as the Revlon PhotoReady. It is a bit cakey, but for oily skin (like myself) it blends beautifully within 20 minutes.

name: Kayla
review: This powder is the best i've ever used. It also has this cool light reflecting thing going on. And i don't feel like i have to blot every hour like ive had to with other powders.

name: cn
review: tried lots of powders expensive and cheap this one is one of the best.

name: Maria
review: Great coverage

name: Alix Lola
review: I have fair, dry skin and this powder pairs well with ONLY my Revlon foundations -- the Colorstay for Dry Skin and Age Defying with DNA Advantage (red top). If I use it with non-Revlon foundations, it cakes up.

name: Cece
review: Powder to lose and just a mess!!!

name: C
review: I hate this product very much. It's caked and messy. Elf is much better. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. Even if you put a little on and press it in it leaves you looking caked and gross.

name: Jess
review: Love it

name: Las Anas
review: Love this product.  Is the only one I use for day to day.

name: Alex
review: I love using this with a liquid or on its own if I'm in a hurry.  Great coverage

name: Britt
review: This powder gives me the best coverage and doesn't cake up or make me oily!

name: rose
review: I have purchased this specific product for a long time and it is the only one I use, so I buy ir before I run out of it

name: amandaleigh00
review: Purchased this along with the matching compact foundation. Tried this and immediately returned it. It went on too cakey and powdery for me. Love the foundation, hate the powder.

name: Jesse's Girl
review: Did not set the foundation. Skin was uneven and shiny.

name: bessie
review: the product was good

name: HRH1078
review: I would not buy this again.

name: Stephanie the shopper
review:
Goes on easy and controls oil!!
Doesn't last too long and hard to bring along for the day cuz breaks in purse!!

name: sam
review: If you're looking for a cheap product that works great, this is it!

name: Caty
review: I use it over the top of my makeup to blend everything together and I thought this would be better than the covergirl compact I had been using to mattify and blend my foundation but I'm just not impressed. I can't see even a little bit of difference. So glad I got it on sale. Never buying it again.

name: Joan looking for glamour
review: Powder was too heavy and messy, clogged pores

name: DD
review: I don't use a foundation but just put powder on after I use a bit of eye makeup.

name: Mdub
review: Since my favorite powder was no longer available, I tried the Photo Ready Powder by Revlon and I love it. It will be my new powder. I don't have to use a lot and it covers everything and makes my face look nice and smooth. It lasts all day as well.

name: sz
review: after applying my foundation I use this product on the oily/shiny parts of my face and it helps my skin look even and smooth.

name: ellieA
review:
I absolutely love this powder. I have combination skin that changes with the weather. My skin is sometimes oily, but then I also live in a very dry climate. It is sometimes tricky trying to keep my skin from looking oily and prevent dry patches at the same time. I have tried so many brands, from drug store to department store brands.
I don't really have blemishes but it seems as I get older that my skin tone is uneven. I like a decent amount of coverage without looking cakey. I have a couple of different revlon foundations that I wear this with. But I will also wear this on top of a light bb cream and even by itself. It lasts all day, especially on top of foundation or my bb cream. It's more matte and prevents the oily look especially when my skin is more oily.

name: shwetadtt8
review: Great Product!

name: Cassandra31
review: This product is great for the summer time mostly because its really sparkly... I would't wear this in the winter at all even thought it does look nice, if you get up close you can tell that there are sparkles on your face... Also if you are looking for some color in your powder the fair is basically a translucent powder so it has barely any color.  If you want a similar product for around the same price I would recommend Revlon's ColorStay Pressed powder. It is basically the same thing but with better coverage and no sparkles.

name: Melhoneybee
review: Amazing powder

name: KJFrenz
review: Pair this with Revlon Color Stay foundation to be shine free all day! Love how lightweight it is!

name: anonymous
review: I use this daily! Coverage is flawless... even photos! It lives up to its name!

name: kk
review: Love the photo ready collection. I put on my concealer and this on top and it's flawless

name: jackie
review: Overall was a great alternative

name: An Accountant with Style
review: This powder has excellent coverage that covers uneven skin tone and controls oil.  The powder is the perfect consistency - some powders I've purchased are as hard as a rock and force must be used to get any on an application brush/pad.  This goes on easily with a brush - very pleased.

name: Busy Mom
review: Love to keep one in my desk drawer at work in case on of those last minute really important meetings comes up.  I will shine, but my face will simply look beautiful

name: emptynest
review: I love this powder.  My new favorite.  It feels so silky and soft on my face.

name: Shopping for Savings
review: Powder covered the shine for longer than other powders. Liked the fact that hide some of my flaws.

name: pooja
review: not satisfied

name: Ev's Chev
review: Great basic coverage, a staple that I return to again.

name: PianoDream
review: This is probably the best product Revlon has made. Good job Revlon!

name: Gypsy Queen
review: This product covers well and blends well also, happy with the result

name: maran
review: At almost $12, I expected this to last more than  a couple of weeks.  I couldn't believe it when my makeup brush broke through the 1/8" deep super shallow cake of powder, and now when I try to use what's left, it breaks apart in chunks.  Totally useless.  And, the funeral flower "aroma" is nasty.  No more Revlon for me.

name: Melissa
review: I have tried so many brands- from the most expensive to the least.  I love all the products in the Photoready line!  Great coverage without being heavy.

name: Kally
review: I used it mostly during the day its great.It feels soft on your face when you touch it.its not too great if you face its really rough,so make sure your face is cleanse before you use especially when going out.

name: aigner
review: pretty good coverage, not great

name: sunnysun
review: It's ok powder compared to its price.  I wish they have a nice puff or sponge applicator over a tiny brush.

name: Nicci
review: I was very skeptical when I purchased this ( I picked up the PR foundation in Shell, the light/med powder and the translucent finishing powder)! It's easily blendable and gives me a perfect dewey finish that lasts all day with out need for touch ups. I have very bad problem skin, so this excites me :-)

name: Stephanie
review: It is usually really difficult for me to find a powder that works since most are for very fair skinned people or very dark skinned people. My skin is a caramel color and I found the powder 020 (light/medium) looks so natural on my skin. It doesn't look like I have anything on. I bought the translucent finisher as well and it gives me that soft finished look. Great product! I finally will start wearing powder!!

name: Autumn in St Louis
review: I would recomend to a friend, and have. I get stopped by women that ask me what I use almost daily. I have oily skin so I use milk of magnesia as a primer to control oil, then apply liquid Photo Ready and Revlon Color Stay blemish correction, and then finish with Photo Ready powder. I have a friend that just switched to this routine, and she swears by it now too.

name: anonymous
review: Wish it was a few bucks cheaper but love the finish I get

name: snoopy
review: I bought it because I needed a new powder.  However, the case is big and bulky and doesn't fit easily in my makeup bag.  I'm going to buy a different brand.

name: laura
review: The liquid goes on great with a sponge, blends seamlessly, even on drier skin spots. Paired with the concealer and powder, it's an awesome full coverage makeup that really evens my skin without looking too "makeupy"!

name: Erica
review: "Works well"

name: BF
review: Carry in my purse for touch ups.

name: JCTX11
review: Light weight. Easy to use... perfect color

name: Susan the Multi-tasker
review: I use a liquid foundation and cream blush first.  Then apply the powder over whole face with a large soft brush.  A little goes a long way.  I then apply a light dusting of powdered blush.  It makes my skin look so smooth and flawless.

name: wantwhatworks
review: I gave it a good try... I really hoped it would give me a poreless finish as promised, but, I took it back and bought Bare Escentuals Finishing Powder again which is a much better product.

name: Queenofcosmectics
review: I have possibly purchased every powder known to woman. I have purchased Make up forever HD powder, prescriptives, Laura Mercier, Bare Minerals, Pur minerals, Sephora Brand, Benefit, MAC, L'Oreal true match and on and on and on.... I figured why not try Revlon? So I went to my local [...] and picked up this powder. The brush is a waste of plastic and silly. Buy a good powder foundation brush (I got mine at [...] Sonia kashuk $13) and apply your Revlon photo ready powder. On you bare skin (after a moisturizer is applied) the coverage is light and leaves your skin with a glow. You can also set your liquid foundation with this. I have oily/normal skin and some large pores and this minimized the pores well. I also am prone to breakouts and this powder left my skin very smooth and breakout free.

name: Taylor
review: The brush that comes with this is horrible. The powder itself is very thick, making it difficult to spread around the face. It's not really good as an overall powder. The look you get is more splotchy and even that doesn't last long.

name: Leah
review: My favorite powder and very affordable

name: Lee
review: I have used this product for 2 years and love it

name: Kt
review: I use this with the BB cream and 24 hour stuff and it doesn't do as good of a job as my other powders at making a nice matte look. It is def not that photo ready.

name: Bama lady
review: POWDER IS GREAT BUT I CAN'T APPLY WITH A BRUSH. NEEDS POWDER PUFF INCLUDED TOO.

name: LK
review: I use this everyday over my sunscreen.

name: Vanessa
review: I typically don't wear foundation, just do a light concealer under my eyes, a little bronzer around the outside of my face, and a couple swipes of blush. That being said, I didn't really have much to "set," other than the concealer. But I like to use a setting powder all over my face to give it a finished look, and set with a spray as well. This powder looked so beautiful when I first applied it- the micro-shimmers were so discreet, but perked up my skin just enough to look so beautiful! But within a couple hours, my skin felt so oily. This powder just didn't last very long on my face. To be fair, it doesn't claim to be long lasting, and I guess the compact makes it easy to throw in your purse for touch-ups. I just want to be done with makeup when I leave for the day. I don't want to be touching up all afternoon. But if I were to touch up, this does give a beautiful look!

name: Shirley
review: This is the second time I purchased this product and after a couple of uses the powder compact breaks into small pieces and I end up throwing it away.

name: Mom on the Go
review: I needed a powder that was lightweight yet covers well and this is it! Loreal has always been my favorite line outside of Dior...ha! Thank you, Loreal for your quality and reasonable price point.

name: Ula
review: Easy to use

name: Sharon
review: I don't like to wear foundation. This is a great powder that covers well with no need for foundation.

name: Cat
review: I have very fair skin and this is the only powder that I've found for a reasonable price that looks natural. It applies very smoothly and really helps to hide my pores--my skin looks flawless! Doesn't cake or crease; lasts for HOURS. That being said, I really dislike the compact. The brush that it comes with is cheap and leaves little bristles everywhere. Make sure that you use your own brushes.

name: Ski
review: This is fantastic stuff!  I have been using it for 2-3 years now, and really love it.  I use it alone over moisturizer.  It covers well, without being heavy, and looks very natural.  I used the light to medium shade in the winter, and the darkest shade in the summer.  It lasts all day.  It isn't cakey and the color blends well with my skin tone. (light to medium with yellow undertones)  I can't say enough good things about this product.  I really like that it isn't messy like some loose powders that are so popular and so expensive.  I apply this with a big powder brush.  Very nice and I think, good for people with sensitive skin.

name: Makeup
review: I absolutely hate this foundation. It's cakey and looks unnatural. You can litterally see it on your skin. I had to scrub to get it off (i was using clinique take the day off) and it irritated my skin.I'm just throwing it away. Total waste.

name: Candi McGehee
review: I use Maybeline  Stay Put Foundation…the two together have the smoothest results I've had in years….very fine milled powder.Love their powder, hate the "LIQUID PHOTO READY FOUNDATION"

name: Sammy
review: Don't normally where powder or foundation, but this product is so easy and works so well in blending and coverage it has almost completely eliminated my need for cover up.

name: Roxane
review: It's ok

name: Kat
review: Powder is light and only a little gives a great finish.

name: j
review: Nice product.  Lightweight.

name: Marie
review: I tried this out because I love the photo ready foundation and it's easier to carry than Bare Minerals but I'm not impressed.

name: Awarwick
review: Not recommended to anyone

name: Darkeyes
review: Lasts all day at work and I have combination skin.

name: Christina
review: Great powder to wear over foundation or just alone. Don't like the brush applicator but pairing it with a powder sponge makes it a great and easy product.

name: adel
review: it keeps my skin oil free for longer and makes my skin look fresh and clean i have bought this product for the first time and will purchase agagin.

name: Seeks Perfection
review: I love how this product is working for me in the summer time. All I have to do is put neutrogena under eye concealer underneath my eyes and if I have a couple of breakouts I put some concealer on there too. I apply the powder on and  it lasts all day and my skin looks fresh and flawless. I'v gotten complements on my skin looking clear and fresh and no one even asks if I wear foundation.

name: Loree124
review: I purchased this on sale. I've used the same face powder for years but the sale price swayed me to try it. "Photo" in the name also caught my attention as we had a family photo shoot coming up.  I used it a couple of times before the shoot and was very happy with it.  I don't wear foundation, just concealer and a little cover up on problem spots.  The powder goes on nicely, I used a sponge, not the brush provided.  It didn't not crease around my eyes either.  On the day of our photos we were outside in the sun for approx 2 hours.  It was a long day and I did not touch up or even look in the mirror until we got home that night approx. 5 hours later.  I was amazed at the freshly applied look that I still had. I can honestly say that even though I had been out in the heat and dust of a rural location, I did not see the need to touch up.  It really did acheive the flawless look I was after.  The fact that it was long lasting was an added bonus.  I'm very happy with it and will look to add more of the photo ready items to my routine.

name: foxycontin
review: I really love this powder. It goes on easily and is light so it doesn't look cakey. I find I don't usually have to reapply and it goes on silky smooth.

name: Suicidegirl
review: I like this product a lot but the brush sucks! After a week it starting loosing bristles all over my face...nice! If you have a back up brush its a great product.

name: Christina
review: I have been using this product since it first came out on the market and I absolutely love it! Great coverage if you want to wear it alone or over a liquid foundation.

name: ranntrev
review: the applicator will remind you of the cheap blush brushes in dollar store makeup. better have your own brushes or pads because you wont get any coverage with the applicator it comes with. it is a seriously light powder, but found it really never covered anything. you put it on and it doesnt give you a finished look at all. i wouldnt waste my money on this stuff. i think the old school covergirl compacts work a lot better than this stuff

name: trish
review: this powder settles into every pore and even the slightest wrinkle!

name: Mollyyy
review: This is the worst powder i have ever uses. unless youre going for that sickly vampire washed out look.....

name: Rachel
review: When I first bought this foundation, I wasn't looking for anything special, you know, just an ordinary face powder to set my foundation. This powder did not impress me at all. The medium/light tone has an awful orange colour that looks terrible, no matter how little you put on, the end result is cakey and unnatural. The only pro to this product is that it seems to be long lasting, and provides average cover. Another thing, the accompanied brush is terrible. I don't think I would recommend this, although some of my friends love it (the ones who love to cake it on anyway)

name: Mommy2B
review: I haven't used a powder compact in years or bought a drugstore brand in years nut I was pleasantly surprised.

name: Animal Lover
review: I ran out of my pressed powder, they don't make it anymore, so I thought I'd give this product a shot. I tried two different shades, and it made my skin seem dull and washed out. The tiny, very small and flimsy brush that comes with this compact is terrible. Not worth the [$], should be priced much cheaper.

name: lazypile
review:
I use this with the coordinating foundation, and I like them both a lot. If you have oily skin it might end up being a bit much. Also if you prefer a matte finish this powder isn't for you. It takes my shine away and replaces it with it with a "glow."

The brush for this is horrible, and not even worth trying to use. I use a soft kabuki brush, though I've also seen the suggestion of using a fan brush. Unfortunately this makes it not very portable, but I'm fine with that.

If you want a use for the included brush (I hate to waste things), it does make a decent blush brush if you like flat blush brushes.

name: JC
review: over my finished product. I enjoy the smell and that this product contains a light SPF and that its oil free. It provides a light to translucent coverage.

name: Jane
review: to light to notice a difference are help the look

name: anna
review: I am a makeup junkie, and I love this product. It is smooth and works well with my skin. The only thing is I got the light/medium since I am an olive skin tone, and it turned out a little too dark, so I got the lighter one and it works great. I am very happy with this powder before this powder I was using nuetrogena powder/foundation, but this tops it by far!!!

name: lauren
review: This is a truley great powder for those with oily skin, it is also wonderful wonderful for anyone with some visible pores. I have oily skin AND large pores and this is my new HG powder and I have tried everything...high end...low end..dupes you know it ! This is great...it doesn't take a whole lot to do the job..I use it sparingly and I apply with a soft powder brush..I don't care for the one included in packaging...I also buy this is a shade lighter than my normal wear as I tend to use finishing powder to tone down my bronzer addiction (I am notorious for bronzer getting the best of me) and this is great for correcting that !
